meanings.definition: A projection on an object by which it may be carried or fixed in place.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase had sturdy lugs for easy lifting.
meanings.sent2: She attached the hook to the lug on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The lug on the backpack decided to take a break.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the lug that held the team together.
meanings.sent5: The lug on the door made it convenient to open.

meanings.definition: To pull or carry with force or effort.
meanings.sent1: He lugs the heavy boxes up the stairs every day.
meanings.sent2: She lugs her backpack to school each morning.
meanings.sent3: The little dog lugs the oversized bone around the yard.
meanings.sent4: She lugs her worries like a heavy burden on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The worker lugs the equipment across the construction site.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a lug and drop that fragile vase!
meanings.sent2: He's such a lug, always tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: The lug at the party kept spilling his drink.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lug trying to dance in high heels.
meanings.sent5: The lug in the comedy show always gets the punchline wrong.
